page.title: 16RELIGION IN ELMBRIDGE
page.content: Most people in the area, when asked what religion they are said, Church of England. One is Catholic and three Methodist. Of these only a quarter attend church regularly, although a further quarter attend occasionally. The only Church in the area is St. Marys Elmbridge where one service is held each sunday either 9am communion, 10-30am family communion or 6-30pm evensong. The rector is responsible for Elmbridge, Elmley Lovett, Hampton Lovett and Rushock, parishes, known as "The Four Square". St. Marys is small and peaceful and was mainly rebuilt in 1870 but still has a south door and two piers from the former 12th century church. The churchyard is well kept as the grave mounds have been levelled, but a variety of wild flowers remain, also a large silver birch and five clipped yew trees. No sunday school.
